title: Cold Brew
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2RIfIzc

by pvnicing

He always thought that the one thing that will always help an artist through a tough phase is art. But maybe he was wrong.

College has never been very hard for Steve. That is until his mind starts to keep him up at night, pinning him to his sketchbook. There seems to be no one he can talk to - not even the people he cares about more than anything.

It’s only when someone from years ago comes back into his life that it start getting better.

title: Time Bomb
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2yXcuAE

by ShaneColton

Tony Stark is not okay.
The events of Civil War have left him broken and the culminaton of all the trauma he’s suffered since Afghanistan have become to much to handle.
He’s alone, more alone than he has ever been, and Tony doesn’t fuction well on his own.
This is a story about brokenness and depression, being surrounded by a darkness so thick it chokes the life from him. But this is also a story about rebuilding a life that’s worth living, recovery, and finding the light at the end of the tunnel.

“What the machines couldn’t fix was the nerve damage and scar tissue, the drug habit he’d thought he’d left behind twenty years ago, and the need to dull his pain with alcohol.”

(Mind the tags. They will be updated as the story progresses.)

blog.name: superhusbands-are-my-life
blog.title: winghead & tin can™
blog.description: ryuu/tony • he/she/they • xviii • korean • writer & roleplayer • the steve to my tony • send me prompts whenever • tony-centric • icon • header

body:
liar

(complete and absolute angst. read at your own digression. post civil war, tony’s point of view. a little canon divergence.)

Tony stares at the shield in his lab, stuffed in the darkest and furthest corner that he could find. He can’t help it. He hates the sight of it. He flinches everytime his gaze passes over it, and it looms in his life, an unforgettable reminder of the memory of it smashing through his arc reactor, the sharp crack of steel. It is the cause of the grating, niggling, and raspy whisper in the back of his mind that leaves him broken and teary at the dead of night with no one around. He remembers seeing that receding backside as Steve walks out of his life like he meant nothing to him. He remembers when he left him like everyone eventually does. He remembers the broken promises.

But he can’t help it. He can’t bear to push it somewhere where he cannot see it, he can’t bear to shove it into one of the many closets he has within the tower, can’t bear to go in any of the rooms where his family- the team- used to live in. He hasn’t touched or let anyone touch those spaces within his tower, hurting too much to stay, broken too much to move on. Stuck. Tony had always known he was self-destructive. He let the wound fester and rot. He lets himself drift in the past. He knows it’s unhealthy, self-destructive, and that it’ll poison him, that it’ll only lead to a painful, slow death, but he does it anyway. He’s dying inside one way or another.

Steve comes into the lab with a plate and a cup, and it’s the smell of heavenly caffeine that causes Tony to rise from the deep entrapment of numbers and code. Steve sets the plate down and hands Tony the cup of coffee into his hand, and he downs it. He goes back to his work with a mumbled thanks, but when Steve doesn’t leave, he sighs. He’s obviously waiting for him to eat. So Tony reaches over to pick up the sandwich, taking a bite idly, eyes on the screen. Steve laughs softly, then reaches over to wipe his mouth free of crumbs, a fondly exasperated look on his face rising from within. The meaning behind those actions is clear. “I care about you.” They state.

Liar.

Steve’s in the kitchen, a warm cup of chamomile tea in his hands, another mug waiting on the counter when Tony stumbles into the kitchen, having just suffered a nightmare, and he jerks in shock at the sight of Steve there. He stares before he pads over, sliding in the seat across from Steve. They’re silent. “I made you tea.” Steve finally speaks after a bit, and Tony gives him a wan smile, taking a sip, grimacing. He hates chamomile tea, but if Steve thinks it’ll help, he’ll choke it down. Steve notices anyway and the next time Tony stumbles out of his room with the fierce, gnawing, bleeding need to get away, he’s waiting. He’s waiting with any melatonin-loaded tea he can find other than chamomile until he finally finds the one Tony likes with honey. His actions speak volumes. “I worry about you.” They state.

Liar.

Steve wraps his arm around Tony’s waist, whining as Tony laughs and tries to extract himself from the super soldier’s grip, but Steve only tightens his grasp and hauls him closer and back into the bed. Tony fights his hold just a little longer before giving up with an exasperated groan, huffing as Steve presses happily into his back in one, hot line from chest to toes, nuzzling his nose against Tony’s neck, arm solidly in place around his waist, pinning Tony against his body. He seems to have no intention of letting him go. Tony wiggles a little, turning around and gives Steve a withering look. Steve just cracks an eye open, smiling sleepily before he leans in and kisses Tony, and Tony can’t find the will to be mad at him. Ah well. Work can wait just a little longer. Steve’s actions only scream one thing. “I love you.” They state.

Liar.

“Liar,” Tony whispers, his voice raspy and breaking apart at the seams, and at some point that he didn’t realize, his face has grown wet and his vision blurry. “Liar.” He repeats, this time a little louder, though no one is there to decipher the agony and the resulting venom behind those words. “Liar… Liar, liar, liar!” Tony finally shouts, his voice rising, the shattered glass and the bloody shards of his heart clear in his cries of torment, sweeping his hand angrily over a desk and everything in it goes crashing to the floor. The clatter of items and the violent throbbing of Tony’s hand brings little relief to his twisting mind and his pulsating soul.

It bleeds, it hurts, and it elicits a deep, guttural sob from his throat as he sinks down onto the floor onto his knees. “Liar.” He sobs out, shoulders hunching as he bends over at the horrible throbbing of his chest. It hurts. It hurts so much, and he doesn’t know when, or even if it will heal. It hurts.

He misses him. He misses those lies. He misses it all.

Steve sets the plate down and hands Tony the cup of coffee into his hand, and he downs it. He goes back to his work with a mumbled thanks, but when Steve doesn’t leave, he sighs. He’s obviously waiting for him to eat. So Tony reaches over to pick up the sandwich, taking a bite idly, eyes on the screen. Steve laughs softly, then reaches over to wipe his mouth free of crumbs, a fondly exasperated look on his face rising from within. The meaning behind those actions is clear. “I care about you.” They state.

Liar.

Steve’s in the kitchen, a warm cup of chamomile tea in his hands, another mug waiting on the counter when Tony stumbles into the kitchen, having just suffered a nightmare, and he jerks in shock at the sight of Steve there. He stares before he pads over, sliding in the seat across from Steve. They’re silent. “I made you tea.” Steve finally speaks after a bit, and Tony gives him a wan smile, taking a sip, grimacing. He hates chamomile tea, but if Steve thinks it’ll help, he’ll choke it down. Steve notices anyway and the next time Tony stumbles out of his room with the fierce, gnawing, bleeding need to get away, he’s waiting. He’s waiting with any melatonin-loaded tea he can find other than chamomile until he finally finds the one Tony likes with honey. His actions speak volumes. “I worry about you.” They state.

Liar.

Steve wraps his arm around Tony’s waist, whining as Tony laughs and tries to extract himself from the super soldier’s grip, but Steve only tightens his grasp and hauls him closer and back into the bed. Tony fights his hold just a little longer before giving up with an exasperated groan, huffing as Steve presses happily into his back in one, hot line from chest to toes, nuzzling his nose against Tony’s neck, arm solidly in place around his waist, pinning Tony against his body. He seems to have no intention of letting him go. Tony wiggles a little, turning around and gives Steve a withering look. Steve just cracks an eye open, smiling sleepily before he leans in and kisses Tony, and Tony can’t find the will to be mad at him. Ah well. Work can wait just a little longer. Steve’s actions only scream one thing. “I love you.” They state.

Liar.

“Liar,” Tony whispers, his voice raspy and breaking apart at the seams, and at some point that he didn’t realize, his face has grown wet and his vision blurry. “Liar.” He repeats, this time a little louder, though no one is there to decipher the agony and the resulting venom behind those words. “Liar… Liar, liar, liar!” Tony finally shouts, his voice rising, the shattered glass and the bloody shards of his heart clear in his cries of torment, sweeping his hand angrily over a desk and everything in it goes crashing to the floor. The clatter of items and the violent throbbing of Tony’s hand brings little relief to his twisting mind and his pulsating soul.

It bleeds, it hurts, and it elicits a deep, guttural sob from his throat as he sinks down onto the floor onto his knees. “Liar.” He sobs out, shoulders hunching as he bends over at the horrible throbbing of his chest. It hurts. It hurts so much, and he doesn’t know when, or even if it will heal. It hurts.

He misses him. He misses those lies. He misses it all.

title: De-Aged Tony
body:
Warnings for: Body Horror, Unreliable Narrator

(A.K.A. I’ve been reading too many de-aged Tony fics where he’s still got the arc reactor and it struck me how ridiculously horrifying it would be for something like that to happen. Cue angsty drabble set vaguely post-IM3 but before the arc reactor removal surgery. Formatting may be slightly off from copying over!)

Tony blinked slowly into awareness. Something felt… wrong, and it didn’t take long to figure out why. He wasn’t where he should be. Or at least, not where he last remembered being.

The air smelled wrong, for one. The bed he was lying on, the blanket he was resting on… all of it felt painfully, horribly wrong. Not literally, perhaps. The blankets were soft. The bed was arguably more comfortable than the one he was used to sleeping on in his dorm room.

But the mere fact that it was different was enough of a warning for Tony.

Part of him didn’t want to know. Didn’t want to open his eyes and confirm what he expected.

But he wasn’t some scared little kid anymore.  Or at least, not in the same way. Fear, after all, was a natural, reasonable, and rational response to danger. He just knew better than to let it rule him now. Knew better than to think tears or panic could help solve anything.

Intelligent brown eyes snapped open and instantly confirmed that no, he was not where he ought to be at all.

Kidnapping, probably. Not immediately obvious who, but if the loud voices outside his door continued escalating volume was any indication, he’d soon find out.

Right. He was Anthony Edward Stark. Nine years old, and smarter than people thrice his age. He’d get through this.

He’d been kidnapped once before…

Scarcely three years old, too curious for his own good, slipped his nanny’s supervision at just the wrong moment…

Too young to properly remember anything, though he had flashes of small details or emotion that could just have easily been nightmares based off the event as anything…

He didn’t remember a Before any more than he remembered the event itself, not really. But he’d been told that once, his mother had not been nearly so distant and lost in her own mind. That once, his father had… well. He fantasized sometimes that he father had once, if not loved, at least liked him. Before he proved himself a liability, a poor investment that his father could never fully divest.

(He did remember, all too well, the day not long after his seventh birthday that he’d been informed by Jarvis he would begin at Idyllwild Academy in July. A year-round boarding school. A week for Thanksgiving, three for the autumn and the winter holidays respectively. Two for Spring. The only complete closure, a five week closure bridging June and July.)

(That first year, he’d come home for every holiday.)

(Last year, he’d only left for Thanksgiving and Christmas.)

(This year, he’d skipped Thanksgiving and only returned to the mansion for Christmas.)

(Not that anyone, except for Jarvis and Ana, really seemed pleased by his presence.)

(How long until they stopped caring too?)

He tried to remember what he’d been doing before this. His last memories before now.

The memories felt fuzzy, distant somehow, but…

He remembered a normal day of coursework. It was… early May? He’d gotten into a fight with Ty, his roommate, over… Tony’s arrogance?… that morning. He’d shown up late to class in a wrinkled uniform because of it.

Mr. Dowan had been unhappy, lecturing him in front of the class about “responsibility” and “laziness” and how “it doesn’t matter how smart you are, Mr. Stark, if you can’t even be bothered to behave and dress appropriately.”

And he’d been humiliated. Indignant. But hadn’t bothered to argue, because arguing against those with authority over him had never helped him before, and that was hardly going to change now.

And then… what?

A normal day? Lunch, dinner, a trip outdoors or to the machine shop or the library? Returning to his room at the end of the day?

He… couldn’t say for sure.

Which didn’t bode well. He’d seen in a movie, once, that people could repress especially-traumatic events from their minds entirely sometimes. He’d researched it later, and it turned out to be a real-life, documented phenomenon.

If Tony was somewhere he didn’t belong, and was obviously missing at least some amount of time…

Well.

His heart pounded thunderously in his chest.

Except… it felt wrong.

He looked down.

He was wearing an over-sized, dark grayed T-shirt. Equally ill-fitting- boxer shorts.

But… that wasn’t what captured his attention.

A blue glow shone through the shirt.

Oh god–

His hands scrabbled at the shirt, revealing the device beneath.

Oh-god-oh-god-oh-god–

A circular, electric-blue device. Implanted in his chest. In his body.

No-no-no-no-no–

Distantly, a part of him recognized that he was panicking.

Oh god was it a bomb he didn’t want to die he didn’t have this when he last remembered oh god what had these people done to him how was he even still alive where had his sternum gone the thing was huge and he could feel, now that he was paying attention, just how deep it went into him oh god–

He couldn’t–

Get it out get it out get it out–

He didn’t realize he was tearing at his chest, at the thing they’d put in him, until he felt hands grabbing him, forcing his own away from the device. He thrashed, kicking and screaming and fighting for all that he was worth, fighting like his life depended on it because it did–

It was getting harder and harder to breathe the more he fought. Spots in his vision, unable to hear anything but the ringing in his ears and an indecipherable stream of voices blending into his own terror–

He was getting light-headed from want of oxygen, his heart was going to beat from his chest, he was going to die–

Anthony Edward Stark, age nine, lost consciousness.

The resultant silence was, in its own way, deafening.

Colonel James Rhodes looked down at the suddenly-limp figure beneath him. Pepper stood a few feet away, eyes wide with horror and filled with tears.

Well shit, James thought. Now what?

He didn’t realize he was tearing at his chest, at the thing they’d put in him, until he felt hands grabbing him, forcing his own away from the device. He thrashed, kicking and screaming and fighting for all that he was worth, fighting like his life depended on it because it did–

It was getting harder and harder to breathe the more he fought. Spots in his vision, unable to hear anything but the ringing in his ears and an indecipherable stream of voices blending into his own terror–

He was getting light-headed from want of oxygen, his heart was going to beat from his chest, he was going to die–

Anthony Edward Stark, age nine, lost consciousness.

The resultant silence was, in its own way, deafening.

Colonel James Rhodes looked down at the suddenly-limp figure beneath him. Pepper stood a few feet away, eyes wide with horror and filled with tears.

Well shit, James thought. Now what?
trail.content_abstract:
Warnings for: Body Horror, Unreliable Narrator

(A.K.A. I’ve been reading too many de-aged Tony fics where he’s still got the arc reactor and it struck me how ridiculously horrifying it would be for something like that to happen. Cue angsty drabble set vaguely post-IM3 but before the arc reactor removal surgery. Formatting may be slightly off from copying over!)

Tony blinked slowly into awareness. Something felt… wrong, and it didn’t take long to figure out why. He wasn’t where he should be. Or at least, not where he last remembered being.

The air smelled wrong, for one. The bed he was lying on, the blanket he was resting on… all of it felt painfully, horribly wrong. Not literally, perhaps. The blankets were soft. The bed was arguably more comfortable than the one he was used to sleeping on in his dorm room.

But the mere fact that it was different was enough of a warning for Tony.

Part of him didn’t want to know. Didn’t want to open his eyes and confirm what he expected.

But he wasn’t some scared little kid anymore.  Or at least, not in the same way. Fear, after all, was a natural, reasonable, and rational response to danger. He just knew better than to let it rule him now. Knew better than to think tears or panic could help solve anything.

Intelligent brown eyes snapped open and instantly confirmed that no, he was not where he ought to be at all.

Kidnapping, probably. Not immediately obvious who, but if the loud voices outside his door continued escalating volume was any indication, he’d soon find out.

Right. He was Anthony Edward Stark. Nine years old, and smarter than people thrice his age. He’d get through this.

body:
Tony Stark Prompt:

The Avengers come up with a plot. One with good intentions, of course, but carried out in a… strange way. They come up with a plan where they entice Tony into a bet/game where the loser has to become the Avengers’ “slave” for a week/month/whatever. Since they were all in on it, of course, Tony loses. However he wasn’t expecting their demands to include taking care of himself. (Like “go to bed” or “eat this food” or “you can only spend eight hours in the workshop” kind of thing.)

summary: Thor and Tony having a deep conversation about Tony’s struggles :
body:
Thor and Tony having a deep conversation about Tony’s struggles :

Thor : But maybe I’m not worthy enough to merit that you’re in good health..

Tony : It’s not a matter of worth. It’s a matter of you against my demons.

Thor : And you ? Are you on my side or theirs ?

Tony : Neither.

Tony : I’m the battleground.

blog.description:
happiness? no, the future holds none of that.
@glorious-imagines. My Writing Blog.@my-magical-oc-s for my oc blog

tags: i dis not proof read this
body:
Home

Thanos had won.

Thanos had won and all eyes were on him.

What to do next?

How could he possibly save everyone from… whatever the hell this was? God, Peter had turned into dust right in his arms. Who the hell knows who else had been dusted. Everything had turned to shit so quickly.

He wanted to cry. But, again, everyone was looking to him for the answers. Strange had said that he was the answer in whatever damn future he saw. Why couldn’t he had told him what to do?

The Avengers HQ. He couldn’t be here, right now. Not with so many eyes on him. Not when he didn’t know whether you were alive or dead. He severely hoped for the former. He couldn’t bare to even think–

He made his way swiftly to the exit. “You’re leaving?” He heard Wanda question and it made him pause.

“Yes, Wanda, I’m leaving.” He gingerly turned to, knowingly, meet everyone’s gaze. No one looked happy, well, even less so than this Thanos situation.

Her arms were folded around her midsection, eyes fiercely piercing his own. She was exceptionally angry. Maybe irrationally so. “Now? Right now?” Her volume was rising, as was his annoyance.

“I’m sorry, I didn’t know I needed your permission.” Of course the response was laced with snark. It was part of his defense mechanism. He was scared.

“Tony…” Steve warned but the beast was surfacing.

He sat back down and stared directly at the redhead. “I’m interested in any plans you’ve come up with to take down Thanos.” There was silence. “Anyone? No? Well, let me help…”

~///~

He’d left immediately after giving everyone an ear full. He didn’t have the time nor the patience to deal with their foolishness. He wasn’t even in the right mindset to think of a way to take care of Thanos. All he needed at the moment was you.

He called first. No answer. He went to your apartment. Your door was left open and you were nowhere to be found. He began to fear the worst. The last place he went was home. There was yelling.

“Stupid piece of junk!” Each word was emphasized by a bang. Loud ones. “Why won’t you tell me where he is?!”

It was you. You were sobbing. Puffy face, blood shot sclera, and runny nose to boot, you were definitely a sight. Your dominant hand was blood as was part of his lab equipment.

He’d give you an ear full as well when this was all over.

“I think Friday has you beat.” You went rigid, head turning so quick he you could’ve gotten whiplash. The tears that fell from your eyes came quicker and more abundant. “How many times must I–”

You had run to him, tackling him to the ground. The pair of you feel with an audible thud. He was in pain already but seeing you alive made it bearable. You straddles him, arms wrapped tightly around his neck. Your sobs had become wails as your body shook and you sniffled constantly.

He hugged your midsection just as firm against him. He offered you word of comfort and reassurance. Even a little sarcasm thrown in between.

When you finally calmed enough to look at him, lip still trembling and tears falling silently on his face he smiled. “Heh, you’re acting like somebody died.”

“Th-that’s not funny!” You swung your dominant hand with the force of a gentle breeze. He chuckled catching it with ease. “I-I-I thought you were dead. Fr-Friday couldn’t–”

He kissed your broken fingers, making you wince. “It’s alright, I’m here now. You can stop with the waterworks.”

He was so happy you were here. Words couldn’t adequately describe the emotions flowing through him. There was a newfound energy and hope.

You’d be there supporting and, somehow, loving him. Your very being bringing him an immeasurable amount of comfort. You, who was his only solace in this cruel existence.

“I love you, y/n.”

Your breath caught a little as your brow rose. That sentence, that emotion, was an extremely rare occurrence. Reserved for just such an occasion.

Your face muscles fell into a warm smile, e/c orbs shining with more of that salty warm liquid. “I love you, too, Tony.” You whined flopping into his arms once again.

For @an-all-write-life Thank You for letting me participate! I had fun writing this (even though I’m not happy with that ending). Hope people like it, I’m very out of practice 😅😅

He was so happy you were here. Words couldn’t adequately describe the emotions flowing through him. There was a newfound energy and hope.

You’d be there supporting and, somehow, loving him. Your very being bringing him an immeasurable amount of comfort. You, who was his only solace in this cruel existence.

“I love you, y/n.”

Your breath caught a little as your brow rose. That sentence, that emotion, was an extremely rare occurrence. Reserved for just such an occasion.

Your face muscles fell into a warm smile, e/c orbs shining with more of that salty warm liquid. “I love you, too, Tony.” You whined flopping into his arms once again.

For @an-all-write-life Thank You for letting me participate! I had fun writing this (even though I’m not happy with that ending). Hope people like it, I’m very out of practice 😅😅

summary: It Might Be You (The Flame Pt. 1)
title: It Might Be You (The Flame Pt. 1)
body:
[Summary]: You knew Tony in college for three years. And in those three years, you had such a crush on him. You’re not really sure if he ever knew, even though there were times when it seemed like he did. And after graduating, you both went your separate ways but you still had those feelings for him. Years later, he reenters your life in the craziest way. And what follows after, gives you so many new experiences in life.

[Pairing]: Tony x reader

Tagging: @captainrogerss @theashhole @dividedwecantfall @peterman-parker @avengerofyourheart @nataliarxmanxva @metalarmproblems @mcuimxgine @capsbuchanan @imagine-assembling-the-avengers @that-sokovian-bastard @hellomissmabel @abovethesmokestacks @peculiar-persephone @bellameys @hymnofthevalkyrie @buckys-shield @callamint @redgillan @lancefvcker @thetalesofmooseandsquirrel @iwillbeinmynest @theassetseyeliner @lilasiannerd @aubzylynn @sgtbxckybxrnes @iamwarrenspeace @kamalakahn @marvelrevival @httpmcrvel @avengersnthings @feelmyroarrrr @redqueen1221

A/N: So after what felt like a million and one years of writing absolutely nothing because all my inspiration AND motivation left me… I’M BACK TO WRITING! This series has been inspired by my ‘Love Songs’ playlist on Spotify (x) and real-life events that have happened to me (although a couple things are different. And each part will be based off a song or two from the playlist). There WILL be smut in this series and I will let you know when it happens. So, without further ado… I present to you this lovely series! This part drew inspiration from these two songs (x) (x)

One year of college down. Three more to go.

You walked up the steps of the main building to get your first class, excited to see your friends from last year. With your books clutched to your chest, you wandered down the hall looking at each door to find the right room number. Suddenly, you heard your name from one of the oncoming rooms and saw your friend Kim waving at you. You smiled big and ran up to her, giving her a huge hug.

“Hey, [Y/N]! How was your summer?” she asked you while the two of you walked in the class and sat down.

“It was good. Got to spend it with the family at our lake house. How was yours?”

“Boring as usual. And aggravating because of my little brother.”

“Is Sarah here?” you asked her.

“No, not in this class. But she’s in another one of our classes so we’ll see her later.”

You glanced around the rest of the room, seeing quite a few new faces. And one of those new faces definitely caught your eye.

He was sitting a couple rows behind you, quietly flipping through the text book. His brown tousled hair, as crazy as it sounds, looked just perfect. And those eyes were perfect as well. Everything about him seemed to be. You just knew that you would have to get to know him.

You immediately turned to Kim and slightly nudged your head in his direction, asking who he was. She looked back and shrugged.

“New guy, I guess. I’m sure the teacher will go through the class and have each of us say our names so we can know who each other is.”

And that’s exactly what happened. 10 minutes later, the teacher walked in and had everyone announce their names.

“Tony Stark,” the man said when his turn came. You immediately repeated the name over several times in your head before the teacher got to you. You almost said his name out loud when you stood up but quickly composed yourself before the embarrassment occurred.

“[Y/N] [Y/L/N],” you said out loud, sitting back down as quick as possible.

You glanced back at him and he noticed, giving you a small smile and wave. You smiled back and waved at him then turning around with your face feeling hot.

This was gonna be an interesting year for you.

The next week you decided that you were gonna try and introduce yourself to Tony, after finally getting the courage to do it. So you walked into class right when the bell rang and sat in the seat next to him. You looked over and smiled as you set your bag down and pulled out your textbook. He smiled back then focused on what the teacher started talking about.

When the teacher’s lecture was over and he assigned work for the class to do, you started working on it but was having a bit of trouble with a few of the problems. You figured this was the perfect time trying to talk to Tony and gently tapped his arm. He glanced over at you.

“Hey, Tony. I can’t figure these out. You think you could help me?”

He gave a small smile and scooted over a bit towards you. “Sure, [Y/N].”

The two of you worked on your papers together for the rest of the class, getting to know a little bit more of each other in the process. When the bell rang for class to be over, he handed you a small piece of paper.

“That’s my number. Call me if you have any more questions on the assignment. Or if you just wanna study. I’m free most nights.”

“Thank you,” you said, feeling your face get hot. “I’ll add it to my contacts list.”

He nodded and started to turn to walk away but then you grabbed his wrist. “Wait.”

The two of you looked down at the situation and you immediately let go of his wrist, your entire body feeling flushed. You set your stuff down, ripped out a sheet of paper from your notebook and wrote down your number.

“Here’s mine,” you stammered, looking down. “If you wanna just hang out… maybe grab a coffee?”

Smiling, Tony took it and stuck it in his pocket. “I’d like that, [Y/N].”

You slowly looked up to see him walking away. And you couldn’t help but stare at every muscle in his body, your eyes wandering lower until they were completely glued to his ass. Snapping yourself our of the daze that you were in, you went to the rest of your classes like you were walking on the clouds.

That night you called him and talked on the phone for over two hours. The conversation first started on the assignment but the went into personal things and learning more about each other. You never felt so giddy in your life; like you were back in high school. And so started the budding friendship between the two of you.

You’d spend as much time with him in class as possible, along with spending a little bit of time outside of it. And as the school year continued, you started to develop feelings for Tony. After all, you guys seemed to be inseparable when you were together in and out of the classroom; especially when it was the two of you hanging out in the spot underneath the oak tree on campus. People just started assuming that you two were a couple because of how much you were together. Even more so because of the way you would sit with Tony while you two studied; his head in your lap, your back against his chest, the way you’d play with his hair and run your fingers through it.

This flirting went on for months between the two of you. And you loved every moment of it. You were practically putty in his hands and you couldn’t help it. There was just something about him that you knew you wanted, yet could never get the words out.   

And even though it seemed like Tony may have had those same feelings, he never once asked you out. You thought it was a bit strange but didn’t want to be pushy about it so you never really asked or brought up the situation. That was until you finally found out why.

You saw him holding hands with a girl, one you’d never seen before, walking to the library. They talked and smiled and laughed with each other; and then standing in front of the doors, he kissed her on the lips. Immediately you turned around, not wanting to have that feeling of your heart sinking to the floor but it was to late. You walked away, feeling your stomach turn into knots.

Was he just playing with you and your feelings towards him? Never once did you think that he was playing you. You never took him to be that kind of person. You considered Tony to be one that actually cared about a girl, especially if they showed interest in him, flirted with him constantly and he was returning the gestures. Yet if that’s what was going, what was his reason for it?

You decided it was time to ask and see what he had to say.

He was sitting a couple rows behind you, quietly flipping through the text book. His brown tousled hair, as crazy as it sounds, looked just perfect. And those eyes were perfect as well. Everything about him seemed to be. You just knew that you would have to get to know him.

You immediately turned to Kim and slightly nudged your head in his direction, asking who he was. She looked back and shrugged.

“New guy, I guess. I’m sure the teacher will go through the class and have each of us say our names so we can know who each other is.”

And that’s exactly what happened. 10 minutes later, the teacher walked in and had everyone announce their names.

“Tony Stark,” the man said when his turn came. You immediately repeated the name over several times in your head before the teacher got to you. You almost said his name out loud when you stood up but quickly composed yourself before the embarrassment occurred.

“[Y/N] [Y/L/N],” you said out loud, sitting back down as quick as possible.

You glanced back at him and he noticed, giving you a small smile and wave. You smiled back and waved at him then turning around with your face feeling hot.

This was gonna be an interesting year for you.

The next week you decided that you were gonna try and introduce yourself to Tony, after finally getting the courage to do it. So you walked into class right when the bell rang and sat in the seat next to him. You looked over and smiled as you set your bag down and pulled out your textbook. He smiled back then focused on what the teacher started talking about.

When the teacher’s lecture was over and he assigned work for the class to do, you started working on it but was having a bit of trouble with a few of the problems. You figured this was the perfect time trying to talk to Tony and gently tapped his arm. He glanced over at you.

“Hey, Tony. I can’t figure these out. You think you could help me?”

He gave a small smile and scooted over a bit towards you. “Sure, [Y/N].”

The two of you worked on your papers together for the rest of the class, getting to know a little bit more of each other in the process. When the bell rang for class to be over, he handed you a small piece of paper.

“That’s my number. Call me if you have any more questions on the assignment. Or if you just wanna study. I’m free most nights.”

“Thank you,” you said, feeling your face get hot. “I’ll add it to my contacts list.”

He nodded and started to turn to walk away but then you grabbed his wrist. “Wait.”

The two of you looked down at the situation and you immediately let go of his wrist, your entire body feeling flushed. You set your stuff down, ripped out a sheet of paper from your notebook and wrote down your number.

“Here’s mine,” you stammered, looking down. “If you wanna just hang out… maybe grab a coffee?”

Smiling, Tony took it and stuck it in his pocket. “I’d like that, [Y/N].”

You slowly looked up to see him walking away. And you couldn’t help but stare at every muscle in his body, your eyes wandering lower until they were completely glued to his ass. Snapping yourself our of the daze that you were in, you went to the rest of your classes like you were walking on the clouds.

That night you called him and talked on the phone for over two hours. The conversation first started on the assignment but the went into personal things and learning more about each other. You never felt so giddy in your life; like you were back in high school. And so started the budding friendship between the two of you.

You’d spend as much time with him in class as possible, along with spending a little bit of time outside of it. And as the school year continued, you started to develop feelings for Tony. After all, you guys seemed to be inseparable when you were together in and out of the classroom; especially when it was the two of you hanging out in the spot underneath the oak tree on campus. People just started assuming that you two were a couple because of how much you were together. Even more so because of the way you would sit with Tony while you two studied; his head in your lap, your back against his chest, the way you’d play with his hair and run your fingers through it.

This flirting went on for months between the two of you. And you loved every moment of it. You were practically putty in his hands and you couldn’t help it. There was just something about him that you knew you wanted, yet could never get the words out.   

And even though it seemed like Tony may have had those same feelings, he never once asked you out. You thought it was a bit strange but didn’t want to be pushy about it so you never really asked or brought up the situation. That was until you finally found out why.

You saw him holding hands with a girl, one you’d never seen before, walking to the library. They talked and smiled and laughed with each other; and then standing in front of the doors, he kissed her on the lips. Immediately you turned around, not wanting to have that feeling of your heart sinking to the floor but it was to late. You walked away, feeling your stomach turn into knots.

Was he just playing with you and your feelings towards him? Never once did you think that he was playing you. You never took him to be that kind of person. You considered Tony to be one that actually cared about a girl, especially if they showed interest in him, flirted with him constantly and he was returning the gestures. Yet if that’s what was going, what was his reason for it?

You decided it was time to ask and see what he had to say.
trail.content_abstract:
[Summary]: You knew Tony in college for three years. And in those three years, you had such a crush on him. You’re not really sure if he ever knew, even though there were times when it seemed like he did. And after graduating, you both went your separate ways but you still had those feelings for him. Years later, he reenters your life in the craziest way. And what follows after, gives you so many new experiences in life.

[Pairing]: Tony x reader

A/N: So after what felt like a million and one years of writing absolutely nothing because all my inspiration AND motivation left me… I’M BACK TO WRITING! This series has been inspired by my ‘Love Songs’ playlist on Spotify (x) and real-life events that have happened to me (although a couple things are different. And each part will be based off a song or two from the playlist). There WILL be smut in this series and I will let you know when it happens. So, without further ado… I present to you this lovely series! This part drew inspiration from these two songs (x) (x)

One year of college down. Three more to go.

You walked up the steps of the main building to get your first class, excited to see your friends from last year. With your books clutched to your chest, you wandered down the hall looking at each door to find the right room number. Suddenly, you heard your name from one of the oncoming rooms and saw your friend Kim waving at you. You smiled big and ran up to her, giving her a huge hug.

“Hey, [Y/N]! How was your summer?” she asked you while the two of you walked in the class and sat down.

“It was good. Got to spend it with the family at our lake house. How was yours?”

“Boring as usual. And aggravating because of my little brother.”

“Is Sarah here?” you asked her.

“No, not in this class. But she’s in another one of our classes so we’ll see her later.”

You glanced around the rest of the room, seeing quite a few new faces. And one of those new faces definitely caught your eye.

summary: Hi! I was watching The Aristocats and loved how O’Malley called Duchess honey and baby so much, could you please write something...
question: Hi! I was watching The Aristocats and loved how O’Malley called Duchess honey and baby so much, could you please write something based on that? Usually in fics it’s tony calling Steve pet names, if you write this could you please swap it around? Thank you so much!!
answer:
(Remember when I asked for prompts way back in like 1912? Well I’ve finally got a couple written! Loved this one, by the way. I think some of these are so good if you imagine Steve’s Brooklyn accent) 

The first time it happened, Tony was so tired he just brushed it off as a sleep-deprived hallucination. There was no way that Steve Rogers, Captain America himself, had just called him ‘sweetheart’. That wasn’t a real possibility.

/

The second time was when they had just finished a battle. Standing out in the cool breeze surrounded by dead aliens, ruined vehicles and the debris of destroyed buildings was the place that Steve chose to start it again.

“Nice job, babe.”

Now, Tony was a smooth-mover, a world-renowned playboy. He had had more partners than most people had had hot dinners. That was why it was obviously a suit malfunction that caused him to stumble over a lump of alien tech and nearly face-plant on the sidewalk when Steve spoke.

Steve’s hand shot out and caught Tony’s arm just in time before he could actually fall. As their gazes locked, Tony swore that he could feel the heat of Steve’s grip seeping through his armour and burning his skin.

Damn, he really needed to take a look at his suit. Something was obviously broken somewhere.


/


Three weeks passed without any more pet names from Steve, but that was probably because Tony wasn’t in the tower – or even the country – for more than a couple of hours at a time. When his manic schedule finally cleared enough to let him rest, Tony was ready to collapse literally wherever he could. And that’s exactly what he did.

Tony jolted awake at the smell of fresh coffee and bagels, blinking slowly as he readjusted to the low light of the room.

“Hm – wha’?”

He was rewarded with a beautiful smile and Steve handing him a mug of steaming black coffee. No, a mocha. Perfect.

“What are you doing here?”

Steve laughed, such a wonderfully-fond sound that made something stir in Tony’s stomach. “You’re on the communal floor, doll, not your own one. Take it you’re tired?”

Tony huffed a laugh as he sat up and wrapped his hands around his mug.

“Don’t know whether I’m coming or going, never mind what day it is. I’ve crossed that many time zones I literally don’t know where I am.”

“Well, at least you’re on home soil now.”

“Thank–,” he cut himself off as a huge yawn racked his body. “Ugh, I need bed.”

Steve smothered another laugh behind his hand. “Yeah, darlin’, you do. Bagels and coffee first?”

“Is that even a question?”

/

Tony had always thought ‘honey’ sounded sarcastic. Maybe it stemmed from his drunk father slurring it at Maria whenever she tried to get him to stand up or get dressed or pay attention to her and Tony. But it didn’t sound that way when it passed Steve’s lips.

“Hey, honey.” His smile was blinding as he turned to face Tony, holding up a box of cereal in a silent question. “Haven’t seen you around for a while.”

Tony dropped down heavily onto a chair at the dining table and shook his head at Steve’s offer. “Yeah, I’ve been down in the lab or at SI. They’re trying to push a new project, but we’ve detected a bug. It’s…” he trailed off and waved his hand. “It’s exhausting.”

Steve grimaced in sympathy and reached for a loaf of bread instead, throwing two slices into the toaster. “Is it over now?”

“I think so.” Tony’s voice was slurred into his arms as he rested his head on the table. “For me, anyway. Pepper made me leave.”

“Good.” Tony hummed when a hand soothed over his hair, fingers scratching lightly at his scalp before Steve’s soft voice spoke again. “You need some sleep, angel. You’re exhausted.”

“Mm.” His sleep-addled mind didn’t even startle at that pet-name, merely leaning into the gentle touch like a kitten desperate for attention. “Come with me?”

There was a smile in his voice when Steve replied, his hand not stopping its motions once. “Always.”

/

They were in a relationship before Tony really noticed what was happening. Steve’s company was ever-present and Tony had come to rely on it more than he had ever thought he would. Things sort of just bloomed from an innocent movie night and a wink in Tony’s direction. The pet names had definitely oiled the way as well…

Damn, Steve was smooth as hell.

/

“What’s on your mind, darlin’?”

Tony nuzzled closer to Steve, pressing his cold nose into Steve’s throat. “What’s with the names?”

“You don’t like them?”

“Now hang on a moment,” Tony murmured quickly, “I never said that.”

Steve pressed a kiss to the top of Tony’s head. “I don’t know where they came from, really. You just bring ‘em out.”

There was a moment of quiet before Steve tightened his arms around Tony’s body and sighed thoughtfully, eyes looking at the ceiling. “Bucky used to use them all the time with every gal on his arm, but I never did. They just never came naturally. Not until you.”

“I like them.”

“Yeah?”

“Mm.”

Steve’s hand started drawing soft circles on Tony’s back as his eyes slipped shut. “You got a favourite?”

Tony thought for a moment before he shook his head slowly. “I don’t think so.”

“I’d better think of some more then hadn’t I, baby? See if we can narrow it down.”

A tiny shiver went down Tony’s spine at that and his lips curved up into a smile. “That one’s up there. Definitely up there.”

summary: Too much love will kill you It'll make your life a lie Yes, too much love will kill you And you won't understand why You'd give...
caption:
Too much love will kill you
It’ll make your life a lie
Yes, too much love will kill you
And you won’t understand why
You’d give your life, you’d sell your soul
But here it comes again
Too much love will kill you
In the end…
In the end. ♚

You’d give your life, you’d sell your soul
But here it comes again
Too much love will kill you
In the end…
In the end. ♚
trail.content:
Too much love will kill you
It’ll make your life a lie
Yes, too much love will kill you
And you won’t understand why
You’d give your life, you’d sell your soul
But here it comes again
Too much love will kill you
In the end…
In the end. ♚

title: lemon squeezy
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2POWGcU

by permahfrosts

“Hold on, hold on, hold - hold the fuck on,” Tony said, or rather babbled, raising his hands, open-palmed toward the man (Greek god, his brain supplied in needless correction) before him, “you’re telling me –”

“I’m telling you,” Steve said, patient as can be, “that The Winter Soldier broke through your firewall. Firewalls? I’unno. Oh. And because of that, he’s in my room.”

A pause. Then:

“Weird.” Tony wrinkled his nose. Steve blinked at him.
